column4: What's the media player called in Ubuntu?  The one that isn't so popular at playing movies?  I think I accidentally uninstalled it.
reinstall the ubuntu-desktop metapackage
I did.
then you have whatever came default
wubi is neither
Theres esvn, rapidsvn, svnworkbench, and a nautilus script thing (so it integrates with your file manager) called nautilus-script-collection-svn
Whats not working?
The apache server.  Every time I try to type in http://localhost, the browser just hangs.
Alright, and apahce is running?  What do your logs say? Also, how did you put the site in a homedir, and for what purpose?  does userdir not suffice?
Where are the logs?
/var/log/apache2
no error.log?
alright, and `sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart` doesn't give anything out of the ordinary?
Where do you have your DocumentRoot? and what are the permissions?
Yeah, userdir does that.  You don't need to move your document root.
I'm sorry, what do you mean?
Theres an apache module that automatically includes /home/*/public_html for serving up
Oh, that config file.  Yeah, all the sites are /home/user/public_html/
gedit won't work without a GUI.  Use nano instead.
And running from the command line gives you what?
Right... use gedit on your local machine, through the command line.
No, that's not what you're saying.  We're not suggesting you run gedit remotely, we're suggesting you run it locally, but through the command line, instead of clicking an icon.
